column4: HI EVERYONE, I NEED A LITTLE HELP HERE, MY DELL MONITOR GOES TO POWER SAVE MODE WHEN UBUNTU IS LOADING AFTER THE BIOS SCREEN, I TRY UPDATE THE INTEL DRIVER PLEASE HELP
oh sorry, sorry i didnt notice my caps lock
hit esc a bunch just before the loading screen shows
edit the grub line and add -s to the end of it
then boot and it will bring you to a terminal
i have never edited the grub line before please instruct me
it shows you commands at the bottom, but it's "e", then add -s to the end of it, hit enter, then type "b"
for the kernel line (the longer one)

i try to do the hitting ESC a bunch of time and nothing, i cant even get on a terminal, now please give me the commands i need to change that line on the grub you talking about, if you can and thanks wawowe
you hit esc right when you see the purple screen, before the loading bar
thats the thing you dont even get to see the purple screen right after the BIOS screen, the monitor goes to power save mode
boot the ubuntu install cd
so i just kept hitting ESC to see if anything comes up, and nothing and i did it for a long time
the framebuffer is what's causing it
need to disable it
ok im on it, i will boot from the ubuntu CD and we go from there, or i can acces the machine on SSH and tell me how to disablethe framebuffer
ssh would be faster if you've got it setup
i dont get to see none of that
im telling you right after the BIOS screen, the monitor goes to power save mode right after
sorry that was for dr_willis
im on ssh now what?
edit /boot/grub/grub.cfg
